org.wiyn.etc.inputSpectra
Class UserSuppliedSpectrum

java.lang.Object
  za.ac.salt.pipt.common.Grid
      za.ac.salt.pipt.common.GenericSpectrum
          org.wiyn.etc.inputSpectra.UserSuppliedSpectrum
All Implemented Interfaces:
AllowingPropertyChanges, PiptData, PiptSafelyAccessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
VNormalizedUserSuppliedSpectrum
public class UserSuppliedSpectrum
extends GenericSpectrum

This class describes the user-supplied spectrum given by some file. The file data must be of the form

wavelength1 flux1
wavelength2 flux2
wavelength3 flux3
...
wavelengthN fluxN

where the wavelengths must apear in ascending order. WARNING: The units of the flux are fairly arbitrary. You should use this class only if it is ensured that the flux values will be properly normalized!

Constructor Detail

UserSuppliedSpectrum

public UserSuppliedSpectrum(java.net.URL url)
Sets the internal URL variable and states that an update is required. No spectrum is crerated yet, as the necessary array is so large that it must be used temporarily only and hence won't be created before it is really needed.

Parameters:
url - the URL of the data for the spectrum
Method Detail

flux

public double flux(double wavelength)
Returns the flux (in arbitrary units) at the given wavelength. If necessary, we first update the spectrum.

Specified by:
flux in class GenericSpectrum
Parameters:
wavelength - the wavelength (in Angstrom)
Returns:
the flux at the given wavelength (in arbitrary units)

setURL

public void setURL(java.net.URL url)
Sets the URL of the user-supplied data for the spectrum and record the fact that the spectrum must be updated before a flux is computed.

Parameters:
url - the URL of the user-supplied data

safeSetURL

public void safeSetURL(java.net.URL url)
Calls the setURL() method. This method is included for compatibility only.

Parameters:
url - the URL of the user-supplied data

getURL

public java.net.URL getURL()
Returns the URL of the user-supplied data for the spectrum.

Returns:
the URL of the user-supplied data

name
